Package space.sunqian.common.net.tcp

Interface TcpClient

All Superinterfaces:
ChannelReader<SocketChannel>, ChannelWriter<SocketChannel>, Cloneable, NetClient<InetSocketAddress,SocketChannel>
public interface TcpClient extends NetClient<InetSocketAddress,SocketChannel>, ChannelReader<SocketChannel>, ChannelWriter<SocketChannel>
Represents a TCP client based on an underlying SocketChannel, can be built with newBuilder().

  • Method Summary

    • channel

      @Nonnull @Nonnull SocketChannel channel()
      Returns the underlying socket channel that supports this client.

      If the read method of the channel returns -1, it means the channel can no longer be read (usually because the peer sent a FIN and entered the half-closed state). In this case, the channel can be closed. If it returns 0, it indicates that all available data from the current read event has been read, but the channel remains alive.

      Specified by:
      channel in interface ChannelReader<SocketChannel>
      Specified by:
      channel in interface ChannelWriter<SocketChannel>
      Specified by:
